oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Maḥmūd Muḥammad Khalīlī and Abū Yāsir
مقابلة مع محمود محمد خليلي وأبو ياسر
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Abraham (Biblical patriarch)--In the Qurʼan
Fairy tales--Arab countries
Princes--Fiction
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Camels; Canaanites; Children; Death; Deer; Disputes; Dream interpretation; Escape; Judges; Killing; Love; Maliciousness; Marriage; Medical care; Patients; Poison; Princesses; Shaykhs; Sisters; Traders; Victory; Wars; Children; Hiding; Homecoming; Kings; Marriage; Shaykhs; Sisters; Slaves; Victory; Arab tribes; Burial; Caves; Death; Disappeared persons; Emotions; Escape; Forests; Hiding; Hospitality; Monsters; Passing on memories; Princes; Storytelling; Abraham (Biblical patriarch); Catapult; Childhood; Devils; Fathers; Fire; Folktales; Gabriel (Archangel); God; Pagans; Punishment; Religious stories; Temples; Worship; Angels; Believers; Childlessness; Fire; God; Hagar (Biblical figure); Ishmael (Biblical figure); Jealousy; Kings; Miracles; Muḥammad, Prophet, 571-633; Protection; Sarah (Biblical matriarch); Sisters; Water resources
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was also recorded with Abū Yāsir, male, born in Palestine and resides in Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع محمود محمد خليلي عام 1995، ذكر, ولد عام 1931 في الجش، فلسطين ويقيم في مخيم البداوي للاجئين الفلسطنيين، لبنان. سجلت المقابلة أيضاً مع ابو ياسر، ذكر، ولد في فلسطين ويقيم في لبنان.
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: The Bedouin prince and his dead wife I. (@ 0:00)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: قصة الأمير البدوي وزوجته الميتة الجزء الأول. (@ 0:00)
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: The Bedouin prince and his dead wife II. (@ 26:44)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: قصة الأمير البدوي وزوجته الميتة الجزء الثاني. (@ 26:44)
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: The prince's beard and his lion friend. (@ 32:7)
Abraham's destruction of imagery and his miracle . (@ 46:14)
Forced departure of Abraham from his land and marriage. (@ 75:4)
oai_dc:dc.dc:tocAR: الترحيل القسري لإبراهيم من أرضه وزواجه. (@ 75:4)
